title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Tuesday 18 August 2015 - BBC News
summary: a £ 20,000 reward is being offered to find the second suspect in an attack on a pregnant former university of bedfordshire student in which she lost her baby .
administrators running a buckinghamshire special school faced with closure say there is one remaining offer on the table .
a college in luton is criticised by teaching unions for `` splashing out thousands of pounds '' sponsoring luton town football club .
an investigation is under way after a fire at a gym in watford which forced residents to be evacuated from neighbouring flats .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: enjoy your evening
text: that 's all from us today on bbc local live for beds , herts and bucks .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow .
if you missed us at all , here 's a brief round-up of the top stories today :

documents.title: carrot-gate : chewy end for three-pronged wonder
text: thanks for joining in a bit of fun today with the carroty three-pronged wonder that seem to cause such debate in our office this morning - just before we go , time to say the carrot/spaceship/claw has been eaten ( and very nice it was too ) .
this is all that remains .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather update : rain moving in tomorrow
text: rain will slowly ease this evening to leave a dry night with clearer skies .
winds will ease slightly and temperatures by dawn will be between 12c and 14c ( 54f and 57f ) .
a much improved day on wednesday with some good spells of sunshine , especially in the morning .
cloud increasing in the afternoon with some rain moving eastwards by the evening .
highs tomorrow between 20c and 22c ( 68f and 72f ) with a freshening south-westerly wind .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: dogs one of most effective weapons against terrorism
text: we 've been looking at the work of the police dogs from the beds , cambs and herts police dog unit .
the four-legged team are busy at luton airport , but it does n't come without its challenges .
on a warm summers day the dogs can work for up to 45 minutes without a break at the airport as they help ensure passengers and staff stay safe .
in this high-tech world their eyes , and most importantly nose , are still providing one of the most effective weapons in the fight against terrorism .
we 'll have more on this in look east , tonight at 18:30 on bbc one ( east ) .
author: Louise Hubball
BBC News

documents.title: luton town could see £ 9m cash windfall
text: luton town could be set for a cash windfall as brentford accept bristol city 's £ 9m bid for
the hatters sold gray to brentford and have clauses in the deal which will see them get a percentage of gray 's sell-on fee .
it could mean luton receive more than £ 1m .
the hatters , meanwhile , take on
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: carrot-gate update : does this carrot look like a carrot ?
text: you 're clearly in a creative mood today as suggestions are still coming in on our
there 's a bit of an ocean theme to these ones : beryl says it looks like a lobster , sudheesh says a jellyfish and nerijus reckons a three-legged octopus .
heather and susan 's
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: bus companies unhappy about busway closure
text: bus companies in bedfordshire are unhappy about a week-long closure of the luton to dunstable busway which is now underway .
the council 's carrying out improvement work following a crash at the start of this month when a driver was thrown through the front window and two passengers were injured .
bus operator
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: series of arsons in birchwood area of hatfield
text: residents in the birchwood area of hatfield are becoming concerned about vandalism and a number of arson attacks over the last few weeks .
hertfordshire police say they 're aware of a series of arsons since the beginning of august and are working to address the problems .
among the incidents , a bmw has been burnt out along with a charity clothes bin for the herts air ambulance .

det insp john hazeldine said : `` a specialist operation has been put in place which involves the increasing of police patrols , both high visibility and covert , and all officers policing hatfield have been briefed about the issue . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: if you 're just joining us
text: the top stories for the three counties :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: attack on pregnant former student : victims phone still missing
text: a phone belonging to a
malorie bantala , 21 , was eight months pregnant when she was attacked in talfourd place , peckham , in south-east london .
one man has been charged and a £ 20,000 reward is being offered to trace the second man .
det insp david suddick said : `` we are appealing for any information about the victim 's white iphone 5s which went missing during the attack .
it has yet to be traced . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: teenage boys linked to hatfield arsons
text: two teenage boys , thought to be about 15-years-old , are being linked to a spate of arson attacks in the birchwood area of hatfield since early august , police say .
residents have expressed their frustrations and concerns in community groups on facebook after a fire in a charity clothes bin ( last night became the latest incident of several .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: slow on m1 southbound
text: there is one lane closed and queuing traffic on the m1 southbound between j12 and j11 due to a fuel spillage and emergency repairs .
elsewhere roads are looking busy - check your journey
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: carrot 's cult sci-fi coincidence : the liberator
text: i mentioned at lunchtime that a funny looking carrot got us talking in the bbc three counties office today well it worked for
i took the liberty to ask you what you thought the three-pronged vegetable looked like and we 've had some great suggestions on
but perhaps the favourite at the moment though is erica 's - she says it looks like the liberator from the cult bbc sci-fi series
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

text: he is this week 's

documents.title: st albans march over `` secretive deal ''
text: st albans march over `` secretive deal ''
author: St Albans & Harpenden Review

documents.title: sniffing out your holiday safety at luton airport
text: it 's the busiest time of year at luton airport with 260 flights a day - among the passengers , the explosives search dogs from
departures represents the highest risk before travellers have gone through security and dogs like five-year-old diesel are responsible for checking luggage for traces of bombs .
the dogs can recognise 12 different substances , and their reward for finding something - a tennis ball of course .
author: Louise Hubball
BBC News

documents.title: former student 'remains devastated ' after losing baby in attack
text: a former university of bedfordshire student `` remains devastated '' after the loss of her baby in a

det insp david suddick said that malorie bantala , 21 , who was attacked in talfourd place , peckham , by two men while eight months pregnant `` has recovered physically from her ordeal , but naturally remains devastated at the loss of her baby . ''
a £ 20,000 reward is being offered to find the second man , described as in his 20s .
one 20-year-old man has already been charged .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: the news in the three counties so far
text: the top stories this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: the big new bradwell clock tower
text: the new bradwell clock tower in milton keynes on a bright , sunny day , has made it as the feature photograph at the top of today 's live page .
the clock tower
do you have any of the three counties you 'd like to feature on the bbc website ?
if so , please

Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: web ellis cup in bedford
text: the webb ellis cup will be at the home of the bedford blues tonight in goldington road in the lead up to the
fans of rugby and indeed the blues are invited along to the ground as the club are holding a public event and encouraging visitors to take a 'trophy selfie ' .
three rugby world cup matches will be held just down the road at stadium : mk .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: £ 20k reward after attack on pregnant former uni of beds student
text: malorie bantala , 21 , was eight months pregnant when two men wearing motorbike helmets attacked her in a street in peckham , london two months ago .
a 20-year-old man has already been charged with child destruction and grievous bodily harm with intent , but the second suspect is yet to be identified .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

# m1 btwn j11 # luton # dunstable and j10 @ twitterid now re-opened .
thanks to @ twitterid for dealing promptly .
thanks for being patient

documents.title: travel : m1 blocked in both directions
text: the m1 is blocked between j11 and j10 in both directions due to a police incident .
traffic is stationary .
normal traffic expected to resume at 14:45 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : largely cloudy
text: a largely cloudy , but dry day is expected .
it should be generally bright , but with only limited sunshine likely .
despite this , it will feel warm .
we 'll see a maximum temperature of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: commuters to face average rail ticket price rises of 1 %
text: rail passengers in the three counties face average season ticket price rises of 1 % in january - the lowest rise since 2010 and comes as average wages are on the rise .
the tuc says that over the last five years train fares have increased three times faster than wages .

but the rail minister claire perry says today 's announcement is a good deal for rail commuters : `` we 've got a five year fare deal here for the first time in decades where you will see rail fares pegged to inflation , no more than inflation . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: a carrot , a chicken claw or a spaceship ?
text: as it 's lunchtime i feel it 's ok to admit we 've a bit of a vegetable dilemma in the bbc three counties office today about newsreader jane killick 's carrot : what do you think it looks like ?
i thought it looked just like a chicken claw , but jane says it looks like a spaceship .
what do you reckon ?
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: hare coursing in hertfordshire
text: allegations of hare coursing with dogs and quad bikes near the village of anstey are being investigated by east hertfordshire rural police .
after searching the scene last night police found no hare courses , dogs , quad bikes or people , but found evidence that a vehicle had been into a field .
the police
no hare coursers , dogs , quad bikes or males located .
we found evidence that a vehicle had been into a field , please stay vigilant .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

text: squeezed council budgets have prompted fears that taxpayers

documents.title: stevenage footballer jailed for hooliganism set to play team whose fans he brawled
text: a professional footballer who was sentenced to 12 months in prison for taking part in football hooliganism
dean wells was found guilty of affray in 2011 after being part of a mob of brentford fans during an arranged brawl with leyton orient supporters outside liverpool street station in may 2010 .
author: The Daily Mail

documents.title: marvel avengers contribute towards £ 9m hertfordshire film boom
text: nearly £ 9m was brought into hertfordshire last year by film companies , including a marvel comic blockbuster starring robert downey junior , samuel l jackson and scarlett johansson .

seventy-nine productions were filmed across the county in 2014 at locations in rickmansworth , watford and st albans for avengers : age of ultron , sky 's comedy-drama apocalypse slough and the bbc 's doctor foster .
the
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: luton town fc : barnfield defend shirt deal and restructure
text: teaching unions have criticised a college in bedfordshire , with a
earlier this month the club announced its new football shirt sponsor as barnfield college - the college defended the move after initial concerns saying the money came out of the marketing budget .

the college says it is undergoing a transformation , after being put into special measures by the government , with college and academies split up : `` our strategy is to have responsible financial stability in-line with national 24 % cuts from central government funding .
job losses are a consequence of any restructure . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: seven to appear at court for vandalising london midland trains
text: seven males are due to appear in court accused of vandalising 22 london midland trains causing more than
author: One MK

documents.title: penn school : parents 'just do n't know what to do '
text: the summer holidays are almost over but the future of penn school in buckinghamshire , which caters for deaf and autistic children , still hangs in the balance .
administrators told parents at a meeting last night there 's one last offer on the table and that the prospective buyers will make their decision by the end of the week .
julie , who 's son goes to the school , told me she is having to look at other colleges : `` we 've just come out of the meeting , they 're still sounding hopeful but there 's nothing concrete .
my son still does n't understand what 's going on , he 's so stressed .
we just need an answer . ''
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: two charged after woman bitten by german shepherd dogs
text: two men have been charged after a woman was bitten by two german shepherd dogs at a property near great amwell in hertfordshire .
it happened in october last year when the woman , who was 30 , had to be treated for life changing injuries to her arms .
a 42-year-old and a 21-year-old , both from london , have been bailed on charges of being in charge of a dog dangerously out of control and various animal welfare offences .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: watford gym fire investigation
text: an investigation is under way after a blaze broke out at a watford gym , forcing residents to be evacuated from neighbouring flats .
hertfordshire fire and rescue service
1/3 - control mobilised a 6 appliance attendance to a fire at a commercial premise on linden avenue .
the fire originated in the sauna &
author: David Keller
BBC News Online

documents.title: delays on the m1
text: an accident has
delays still remain southbound on the m1 between j12 and j11 due to a lane closure to allow for emergency repairs and a clean-up operation .
on the m25 anticlockwise , between j25 and j24 for potters bar , there 's one lane closed and slow traffic due to a broken down coach .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: luton town fc : barnfield shirt deal 'a bad decision '
text: barnfield college in luton has been criticised by teaching unions for sponsoring luton town football club .
the college has a

`` we 've got a set of staff in the college who 've gone through a number of years of upheaval now and that 's included job loses '' , ben monks from the university college union which represents a number of staff at the college
`` i think what we 've got is a bad decision by the college to put spending money on a sponsorship deal above spending on staff and frontline services for students . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: bikes stolen from railway stations
text: british transport police has issued images of three people they want to trace after
pc alex norstrom said : `` on wednesday , 3 june , a man secured his racing bike in the racks at hemel hempstead station .
when he returned later the same day it had gone .
`` a month later , on wednesday , 1 july , a road bike was stolen from the racks at apsley station .
we need to speak to the three men as we believe they have important information about these thefts . ''
author: David Keller
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel update : delays on the m1 continue
text: there are still severe delays on the m1 southbound between j12 and j11 due to a fuel spillage and emergency repairs .
congestion back to j14 .
there 's heavy traffic on the a5 southbound in dunstable between the a505 junction and houghton road .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: penn school : one last offer
text: it looks as if the future of penn school will be decided by the end of the week .

little over a month after parents were told the facility for deaf and autistic children had gone into administration , they 've been told there 's one last offer on the table - but if the buyers do n't proceed , that 's it .
i went to the meeting in penn last night and caught up with one of the administrators , lee manning .
he said if the offer is withdrawn , or simply can not proceed because of various hurdles that ca n't be overcome , then `` regrettably we 've run out of options in terms of rescuing the school '' .
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : cloudy but dry
text: a largely cloudy but dry day is expected , with it being generally bright but with limited sunshine .
despite this , it will feel warm .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
it will be dry through the evening and overnight .
there will be a good deal of cloud but also one or two breaks developing later .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: marks and spencer worker threatened with axe
text: a staff member at marks and spencer in high wycombe was
they are trying to trace darren robertson , 29 , in connection with the theft that took place at 19.25 on saturday on the ryemead way retail park .
thames valley police report a man `` threatened a member of staff with an axe , took a quantity of cash from the till and then left on a bicycle '' .
no-one was hurt .
darren robertson also goes by the name of esa muslim-ali .
officers have asked that anyone who knows of his whereabouts to get in touch .
author: David Keller
BBC News Online

author: David Keller

documents.title: travel update : m1 delays in bedfordshire
text: one lane is closed and there 's very slow traffic on the m1 southbound , between junctions 12 and 11 near toddington , because of a fuel spill .
emergency repairs are also taking place and congestion is going back to j13 for the a421 .
there 's heavy traffic on the m25 anticlockwise between junctions 17 and 16 near maple cross , and there are delays at the black cat roundabout on the a1 at great barford .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning
text: morning , hope all is well .
it 's tuesday 18 august and from now until 18:00 we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel for beds , herts and bucks .
we 've got the latest on the penn school to tell you about , and there 's a full travel update coming soon .
in the meantime be aware if you 're heading towards the m1 - a
please get in touch with us at any point by sending in your stories , comments and via
